docs.title: Music Logger Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the official documentation for the Music Logger app.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This site contains all legal and privacy-related information regarding the usage of the Music Logger app and its services.

  • Privacy Policy
  • General Terms and Conditions (AGB)

docs.title: 1. Scope of Application
docs.text:
These General Terms and Conditions (GTC) govern the use of the apps "Music Logger" and "Music Hunter" (hereinafter referred to as "Apps") by consumers. The provider of the Apps is:

Dj Chami & Chantre Productions UG Germanusstrasse 30 52080 Aachen Germany VAT ID: DE341535251 Email: chami@dancefusionaachen.de

Deviating terms and conditions of the user shall not apply.

docs.title: 2. Description of Services
docs.text:
(1) Music Logger is an app for the automated recognition and logging of music played at events, parties, or comparable occasions (focused on DJs). (2) Music Hunter is an app for the passive background recognition of music in daily life (focused on listeners).

(3) Both Apps capture the following information: * Recognized song title * Recognized artist (author) * Time of playback * Location or event reference (if provided by user)

(4) The following are NOT captured or stored: * Conversations or voice recordings * Voices of individuals * Other audio content outside of music * Personal data of guests or third parties

(4) The App serves specifically for the documentation of played music and the avoidance of song duplications.

(5) Music recognition is performed automatically via external music recognition interfaces, primarily utilizing Shazam (Apple) technology. Integrated playback functionalities are provided via Spotify.

(6) The average recognition accuracy of the App is approx. 80%. A complete or error-free recognition of all played songs is technically not possible.

(7) The functionality of the App is particularly restricted or excluded if: * unreleased songs or songs not recorded in databases are played, * songs are heavily altered in their speed, pitch, or structure, * there is no stable internet connection, * the audio quality at the recording location is insufficient.

docs.title: 3. Activation and Consent
docs.text:
(1) Music recognition occurs exclusively following active usage by the user. Recording does not take place without the user's knowledge.

(2) By using the App, the user confirms that they are authorized to perform music recognition at the respective location and that no third-party rights are being infringed.

docs.title: 4. Registration and User Account
docs.text: (1) Use of the App requires the creation of a user account. (2) The user is obligated to provide truthful information during registration and to keep access data confidential.

docs.title: 5. Cost Model
docs.text: (1) Music Logger is offered in a free basic version as well as in paid subscription models. (2) Prices, terms, and cancellation conditions of the subscriptions are displayed transparently prior to the conclusion of the contract.

docs.title: 6. Display and Export of Logs
docs.text: (1) Users can view their recorded music logs within the App and export them in suitable file formats. (2) Responsibility for the further use or publication of exported data lies exclusively with the user.

docs.title: 7. User Obligations
docs.text: (1) The App must not be used for the surveillance of persons, secret recording in private spaces, or illegal purposes. (2) The user ensures that usage does not violate applicable laws, domiciliary rights (house rules), or contractual obligations.

docs.title: 8. Liability and Warranty
docs.text: (1) No guarantee is assumed for the completeness or correctness of the music recognition. (2) The provider is not liable for incorrect song recognitions or technical failures. (3) The provider assumes no responsibility for GEMA, licensing, or copyright obligations of the users. (4) The provider is not liable for restrictions resulting from the use of external services (e.g., Shazam API, Spotify API) or lack of internet connection.

docs.title: 9. Availability
docs.text: The provider strives for high availability but owes no uninterrupted use.

docs.title: 10. Data Protection
docs.text: Information regarding the processing of personal data is regulated in the separate Privacy Policy.

docs.title: 11. Termination of Contract
docs.text: (1) Users may terminate their account at any time. (2) The provider may terminate the contract in the event of serious violations of these GTC.

docs.title: 12. Regional Availability
docs.text: (1) The App is generally available worldwide. (2) Exclusion: The use of the App is currently not available and not supported in the following regions: Brazil, South Korea, and Japan. Users in these regions are excluded from the service due to regional regulatory requirements.

docs.title: 13. Final Provisions
docs.text:
(1) German law applies. (2) Should individual provisions be invalid, the remaining regulations remain unaffected. (3) The place of jurisdiction is—to the extent legally permissible—Aachen, Germany.

Status: February 2, 2026

docs.title: Data Deletion Instructions
docs.text: You can permanently delete your account and all associated data at any time. We offer two methods to do this:

docs.title: 1. In-App Deletion (Recommended)
docs.text:
The easiest and fastest way to delete your data is directly within our apps (Music Logger & Music Hunter).

  1. Open the app and navigate to the Settings screen.
  2. Select the Account section.
  3. Tap on the "Delete Account" button.
  4. Confirm the deletion. Your account and all cloud data (recognition history, user profile) will be permanently erased.

docs.title: 2. Deletion via Email Request
docs.text:
If you are unable to access the app, you can request deletion by sending an email to our support address:

  • To: music.logger.app@gmail.com
  • Subject: Data Deletion Request

Please send the email from the address associated with your account to help us verify your identity.

Status: February 19, 2026

docs.title: Privacy Policy
docs.text: Effective Date: February 19, 2026

docs.title: 1. Responsible Contact (Controller)
docs.text: Dj Chami & Chantre Productions UG Germanusstrasse 30 52080 Aachen, Germany Email: music.logger.app@gmail.com

docs.title: 2. Audio Data Handling (Microphone Access)
docs.text: To provide the core "Background Recognition" feature, the apps (Music Logger & Music Hunter) require the android.permission.RECORD_AUDIO permission.

docs.title: Collection & Usage
docs.text:
• Collection: We collect audio data solely for the purpose of identifying music playing in your environment.
  • Processing: Audio is processed in real-time. The audio stream is processed directly on your device to generate a unique digital fingerprint.
  • No Permanent Storage: We do not permanently store raw audio files on your device or our servers. The raw audio buffer is discarded immediately after the fingerprint is generated.
  • No Audio Transmission: No raw audio files are ever transmitted to our servers or any third parties.

docs.title: 3. Third-Party Data Sharing
docs.text: To provide our services, we partner with selected third-party providers.

docs.title: 3.1 Apple Music / ShazamKit
docs.text: To identify songs, we use external services provided by Apple (Shazam). * Data Shared: Only an anonymous digital fingerprint is shared. This fingerprint cannot be reversed into intelligible audio. * Purpose: To retrieve song metadata (Title, Artist). * Policy: Usage is also subject to Apple's Privacy Policy.

docs.title: 3.2 Spotify
docs.text: We integrate with Spotify to provide direct playback features. * Data Shared: When you connect your Spotify account, we transmit search queries (Song Title, Artist) to Spotify to locate tracks. * Permissions: We request access to your basic profile (user-read-private) to authenticate requests. We do not access your private playlists or listening history. * Security: Authentication tokens are stored securely on your device. We do not process or store your Spotify credentials. * Policy: By connecting your account, you agree to Spotify's Privacy Policy.

docs.title: 4. Data Retention & Deletion
docs.text:
• Recognition Logs: Metadata (Title, Artist, Timestamp) is stored locally and, if Sync is enabled, in our secure Supabase cloud.
  • Account Deletion: You can delete your account and all associated cloud data at any time:
    • In-App: Settings -> Account -> Delete Account.
    • Email: Contact music.logger.app@gmail.com with the subject "Data Deletion Request".

docs.title: 5. Security
docs.text:
• Encryption in Transit: All network communication is transmitted over secure HTTPS / SSL connections.
  • Encryption at Rest: Sensitive account data is encrypted in our cloud database.

docs.title: 6. Your Rights (GDPR)
docs.text: Under the GDPR, you have the following rights: * Access & Correction: Request details or corrections of your data. * Deletion: Request the erasure of your data. * Withdrawal of Consent: Revoke microphone permissions at any time in device settings. * Complaint: Lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority (e.g., LDI NRW).
